comment.author: 48094458@N00
comment._content: Volvo didn't make many cars in the early years- mostly trucks.  Their best sales year before the war was about 2000 units.  This is a rare one.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Looks like a very modern building, even today.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] Yes Brian, thats what struck me too, the building would not be out of place in a present day planned town but the cafe beside it looks ancient!

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: The town hall looks more 1960's than 30s or 40s. Still a great picture.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: The town hall looks indeed quite modern, still it was built in 1938, created by the Swedish architects Yngve Ahlbom and Nils Sterner. It was made in red brick - a tradtional building material in Halmstad. /Anna B.
